runs.comm: full, on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
almost yorker length from Edwards, swinging a touch into Warner, who gets a thin inside edge on to hid pad, which saves him from an lbw decision
length ball, on the stumps, played to cover
pitched up and Warner swings his arms through it, smashing it on the half-volley <del>past extra-cover</del> ... no, wait, a superb diving stop keeps the damage to one
pacy delivery, in the corridor, Watson swishes and misses
gone, caught at slip! Watson was done for pace, Edwards whipping the ball through outside off and the Australia opener attempted a loose cut away from his body, only to edge to West Indies' captain
tossed up outside off, played out towards cover
on the stumps, defended coming forward
shorter delivery, on the legs and Warner pulls but finds the man at short backward square
flighted, dipping outside off, driven past point, who makes the stop but can't hold on to the ball
flatter, on the stumps, whipped to leg where a diving Fidel Edwards half fields
length, blocked towards mid-off from in front of the stumps
bouncer, Bailey hooks ... dropped him! It flew hard and flat to Johnson Charles at long leg, he positioned himself to take it but it popped out of his grasp as he went with fingers up. Oh, Johnson!
pitched up across the left-hander, wide of off stump, and shovelled over the infield for the first boundary of the innings
around the wicket, holds a line wide of off, Warner goes down on one knee to slog but gets nothing on it
straight through him this time! Speared, fast and bouncy, Warner swings across the line and the ball whistles just past the stumps
bouncer, leaping up towards the throat, Warner rocks on his heels and guides an uppercut over point to the square boundary. Have at you!
length ball this time, on the stumps and driven to mid-on
on the stumps, tucked short to cover
tossed up, straight delivery, not much turn and Bailey launches the ball back over long-on, for a mighty maximum
shorter, on the stumps, Bailey tries to pull again but can't get it away
sweeps from in front of the stumps to deep backward square leg
flat, outside off, dabbed to short third man, the batsmen change their mind after starting to run and Bailey where's the throw on the back of his thigh
drops short on the leg side, Warner smashes the ball up and over the deep square leg boundary like a man throwing a brick down a mineshaft
short and pulled to deep square leg
back of a length on the off side to Warner and he punches a cut shot through the infield. Not a great start from Sammy
Baugh up to the stumps, fuller length, crashed towards extra-cover on the drive where Pollard makes a diving stop
short and wide again, slapped dismissively through point for another boundary
length, tighter line outside off, Bailey goes back and guides the ball to short third man
on the stumps, doesn't really get up off a length, pulled flat towards deep backward square
length, down the leg side and not much turn, helped on its way to the boundary by Bailey
outside off, steered to short third man
full, outside off, worked into the leg side
flighted on the stumps, dug out to mid-on
flatter delivery, carrom ball I think, on the stumps, dispatched far back over the bowler's head for another six!
width outside off and slashed hard through point
back of a length outside off, seaming in a touch, pulled through midwicket
takes the pace off it, nurdled away on the off side
pitched up on the legs, clipped to deep backward square
good length, not much room to work with it outside off, chopped down to third man
drifts down the leg side, punched off the pads and deep square leg has to come round to field
full length, on the stumps, whipped away on the full to deep midwicket
pitched up, in the slot and Warner smacks it back over deep midwicket. Ouch
flatter, across Warner, nudged to cover

a breakthrough from Samuels, as Bailey top-edges a sweep and deep square leg takes the catch running in from the boundary! Australia's captain (yep, the right one, this time) is caught with his fingers in the cookie jar and the tourists are two down
quicker ball, almost a medium pace yorker, beats the batsman outside off
length, not much turned, chopped to point who makes the save
angled across and this time Warner gets a run to point
pitched up, just outside off, driven into the ground and taken at extra-cover. The crowd get excited for a moment, but it was a bump ball
slightly back of a length, rolls the fingers over it, blocked back to the bowler
tossed up, slower ball again, Warner waits and punches into the gap in front of deep midwicket and they steal two
full, on the legs, glanced to short third man - he has a shy but misses as they scramble a single
slightly full, on off stump, driven through cover - Hussey is off the mark first ball
pitched up, driven out to the fielder on the cover boundary
on the stumps, dribbled down the ground to long-off
tossed up, deflected to short third man
top-edged as Hussey plays across the line ... but it falls short of long-on as he comes in off the rope. Lucky, Hussey, lucky
flatter, pushed through outside off, dabbed to short third man
dropped short behind point and again they steal one
slanted across, length ball, driven through the covers
back of a length, outside the left-hander's leg stump, pulled away square
on the body, clipped square on the leg side ... Pollard breaks the stumps at the non-striker's end when the throw comes in bit he didn't take it cleanly anway
length ball, played fine on the leg side
fuller, on off and driven, fielded by mid-off
back of a length, on leg stump, nudged round the corner for one - that's a well-paced fifty for Warner
full, on the stumps, punched through midwicket
flat and straight, no need for Hussey to worry about the turn and he sweeps BIG over deep midwicket
outside off, drilled to the cover sweeper
tight line across the batsman, played to cover
flighted, driven down the ground for one

given some air, miscues with a heave to leg and chips back to the bowler! Samuels strikes again! The ball didn't do much but Hussey's bat turned in his hands and the ball flew off the bottom of the bat straight back to the bowler
length outside off, played square through cover-point
length, driven to long-off
drops short and Warner bombastically hooks high over deep square leg. I think he's lost the ball ...

direct hit from mid-on removes Warner! They went for a second, taking on the arm of Dwayne Bravo, who charged in from the rope, picked up the ball in one hand and threw down the stumps in one smooth movement. Game changing?
defended in front of the stumps
flatter delivery, nudged into the leg side
played off the batsman's legs, Mathurin fields himself and also hits the stumps - but Wade was just back
on the stumps, turning across, played towards square leg off the pads
length, turning across, dabbed to point
tossed up, no real turn and Wade swings away across his front pad to the backward square boundary
turn and bounce off a length, beats the outside edge
on the stumps, goes back and nudges behind point
outside off, comes forward and knocks into the off side
back of a length, on the legs, Wade hops back and glances square
fast and straight, whipped from in front of the stumps to the man at midwicket
well outside off and the batsman can't get anywhere near that
back of a length, outside off, swings and bottom edges past the stumps to short fine leg
angled across, driven through the covers off a good length
full and wide - Edwards thinks it was inside the return crease; the umpire doesn't
rolls his fingers over it, edged on to the crease, Edwards cleans up off his own bowling to prevent a run
is that a drop? I think it is ... It was a full-pitched delivery, Hussey tried to dig it out, got the toe of the bat on it, but Baugh couldn't hold on and the ball scooted away for four
tossed up on middle and Wade clears his front foot out of the way and thumps the ball back over long-on
leg stump, flicked off the pads square of the wicket
on the stumps, blocked back to the bowler
played off the pads to short fine leg, good work from the fielder and then Narine ensure the bails are broken at the non-striker's end ... but Hussey's bat was just in
flighted on the stumps, driven with a flashing blade to extra-cover, who can't quite make the stop
on the stumps, chopped back down the wicket
pitched up and his first ball is lofted over extra-cover and away to the rope for four! Not the start his captain wanted
good length, on the stumps, Hussey comes forward and whips a brutal aerial drive over long-on - that was clinical hitting
fuller length, on the stumps, driven to long-on
full, on the stumps and a touch slower, Wade can't get his drive away
rolls his fingers over it again, turning it into an offcutter - Wade swings and misses, with the ball swerving past off stump on its way through to the keeper
length, again taking the pace off, clubbed down the ground
full, flat and quick, beats Wade outside off stump
pushed across the batsman, driven to cover
flighted a bit more, turning across the batsman who misses with a big swing, Baugh removing the bails just in case

caught and bowled! It was basically a full toss and Wade smacked it straight back at Samuels, who anticipated the catch and took it comfortably moving to his right. But hold on, they're checking whether was a no-ball on height ... No, it was close but he's been given out
full, on the stumps, chipped down the ground wide of long-on and they take a couple
length outside off, Christian plays a premeditated paddle shot to short fine leg
full and wide, chipped straight to extra-cover! Christian was nowhere near the pitch and simply levered the ball to Sammy at head height
two in two balls for Edwards! Full, fast and straight, drifting in to the batsman and off stump goes pinwheeling away! Lee saw nothing off that - and Edwards is now on a hat-trick ...
length, quick and seaming back in, McKay prods tentatively but it's too good for him
pitched up, steps back and makes another air shot
slings down a full toss on leg stump and McKay batters it down the ground for six! He gave that some humpty
superb reply, a yorker wide of off stump, McKay had backed away and missed with a swish of the bat
full, swinging towards leg stump, shovelled to deep backward square and they scamper through for one
slight change in pace, angled in from wide of the crease, McKay misses with a swipe as the ball sails past leg stump ... Baugh then hits the wicket but the batsman had grounded his bat
length, on the stumps, dumped in front of midwicket for a single

gone, what a catch from Pollard! Hussey fastened on to a full ball on the stumps and thumped it out towards deep midwicket, where Pollard, running round from long-on dived full length to grasp the ball in his bucket-like hands

slower ball on off, bowled him! Bravo is aeroplaning around the outfield after taking West Indies to the brink of victory. The ball was too good for McKay, who tried to hit it out of the ground but lost his off stump
length ball, on the stumps, hooked out towards wide long-on, they come back for a couple but it's nowhere near enough - West Indies have won by 14 runs!
